sen.j: 神応寺（しんのうじ）は、京都府八幡市にある曹洞宗の寺院。
sen.e: Shinno-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Soto Sect located in Yawata City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shinno-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Soto Sect located in Yawata City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shinno-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Soto Sect located in Yawata City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Itosugiyama.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Itosugiyama.
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple) is Itosugiyama (Mt. Itosugi).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.e: The principal image is Yakushi Nyorai.
The principal image is Yakushi Nyorai.
The principal image is Yakushi Nyorai (the Healing Buddha).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: この寺は、貞観 (日本)年間（859年～877年）行教によって創建されたと伝えられ、江戸時代には江戸幕府から朱印状を与えられていた。
sen.e: Shinno-ji Temple is said to have been founded between the years 869 and 877 by Gyokyo, and was granted a trade license from the Edo Shogunate during the Edo period.
Shinno-ji Temple is said to have been founded between the years 869 and 877 by Gyokyo, and was granted a trade license from the Edo Shogunate during the Edo period.
Shinno-ji Temple is said to have been founded 859 and 877, and was granted a trade license from the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
